Posts.Content: jabberwocky57 wrote: My wife will be visiting a surgeon next week. We believe it was caught early. From what we've read, a SERM would be the usual course of action (after surgery). We've read about horrible side effects from those medications that might last over many years. Would opting for a double mastectomy mean not having to do the hormone regulating drugs? Is that a reasonable option? Do most women deal with join pain and bone loss if they use an SERM? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Wife = Er+ Pr+ Her2- Options besides hormone therapy? jabberwocky57 Jons_girl
